title: MD
biography: Lee Byung-chul was a South Korean businessman who founded the Samsung Group, the country's largest chaebol (conglomerate). Lee founded Samsung in 1938, at the age of 28. He is widely recognized as one of the most successful business magnates in South Korean history.
aiSummary: Byung-Chul Cho is a medical oncology specialist with an H-index of 70 at Yonsei Cancer Center (Member). Has been published in Nature Genetics, Nature Communications, Cellular Immunology. Based in Unknown, Unknown, Global.
